column2: cantāte Dominō, omnis terra. ^ Sing ye to the Lord a new canticle
column3: sing to the Lord, all the earth.

column1: 2 ^ Cantāte Dominō, et benedīcite nōminī ejus
column2: adnūntiāte dē diē in diem salūtāre ejus. ^ Sing ye to the Lord, and bless his name
column3: show forth his salvation from day to day.

column2: in omnibus populīs mīrābilia ejus. ^ Declare his glory among the Gentiles

column1: 4 ^ Quoniam magnus Dominus, et laudābilis nimis
column2: terribilis est super omnēs deōs. ^ For the Lord is great, and exceedingly to be praised
column3: he is to be feared above all gods.

column2: Dominus autem caelōs fēcit. ^ For all the gods of the Gentiles are devils
column3: but the Lord made the heavens.

column1: 6 ^ Confessiō et pulchritūdō in conspectū ejus
column2: sanctimōnia et magnificentia in sanctificātiōne ejus. ^ Praise and beauty are before him
column3: holiness and majesty in his sanctuary.

column1: 7 ^ Afferte Dominō, patriae gentium, afferte Dominō glōriam et honōrem. ^ Bring ye to the Lord, O ye kindreds of the Gentiles, bring ye to the Lord glory and honour.

column2: tollite hostiās, et introīte in ātria ejus. ^ Bring to the Lord glory unto his name
column3: bring up sacrifices, and come into his courts.

column1: 9 ^ Adōrāte Dominum in ātriō sanctō ejus
column2: commoveātur ā faciē ejus ūniversa terra. ^ Adore ye the Lord in his holy court. Let all the earth be moved at his presence.

column1: 10 ^ Dīcite in Gentibus quia Dominus regnāvit. Etenim corrēxit orbem terrae quī nōn commovēbitur
column2: jūdicābit populōs in aequitāte. ^ Say ye among the Gentiles the Lord hath reigned. For he hath corrected the world which shall not be moved
column3: he will judge the people with justice.

column2: commoveātur mare, et plēnitūdō ejus. ^ Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad
column3: let the sea be moved, and the fulness thereof.

column1: 12 ^ Gaudēbunt campī, et omnia quae in eīs sunt
column2: tunc exsultābunt omnia ligna silvārum, ^ The fields shall rejoice, and all things in them
column3: then shall all the trees of the woods rejoice,

column1: 13 ^ ā faciē Dominī, quia venit, quoniam venit jūdicāre terram. Jūdicābit orbem terrae in aequitāte, et populōs in vēritāte suā. ^ before the face of the Lord, because he cometh, because he cometh to judge the earth. He shall judge the world with justice, and the people with his truth.
